title.value: Продуктивность многолетних бобовых культур на дефляционно-опасных почвах Белорусского Полесья
Productivity of perennial legumes on wind erosion threatening soils of Belorussian Polesye

journal.title: Soil Science and Agrochemistry : scientific journal

person.name: Gaponyuk, A.N., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center for Arable Farming (Belarus). Institute for Soil Science and Agrochemistry
Kostuychenko, N.N., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Polesye Agrarian Ecological Inst. (Brest)

abstract.value: In course of the research there was stated the data on perennial legume crops productivity on various wind erosion dangerous soils. The field experiments were realized in the conditions of the Republic of Belarus on the experimental stationary of 'Mukhavets' in Brest region, laboratorial experiments – in Polesye Agrarian Ecological Institute (Brest) in 2010-2012. As a result of realized research it was revealed, that the greatest perennial grasses yield was obtained on peat-mineral and sod-gley soils. Forage crops cultivation on sod-podzolic light gley sandy soils leads to sharply decreasing of green mass and dry matter and also raw protein yield. Cultivation of alfalfa (Medicago sativa) on peat-mineral and sod-gley sandy soils in Polesye region promoted reception of a qualitative forage with high gathering of a crude protein and an exit of fodder units in comparison with other kinds of long-term bean grasses (a clover meadow (Trifolium pratense L.), Sainfoin sandy (Onobrychis), bird's-foot trefoil (Lotus cornicutus L.)). Agrochemical properties of arable horizons of investigated soils of the experimental stationary, dry matter crop yield of perennial legume in various years of use in dependence on soil type were presented.
